data.name: Array
data.value: This object provides a way of storing more than one value for a given name. These values can be accessed by another index.

data.name: Array_ContainsIndex
data.value: Gets whether or not the array contains the specified index. This is very useful when deciding if the array's index was initialized by some value or not.

data.name: Array_ContainsIndex_array
data.value: The array to check.

data.name: Array_ContainsIndex_index
data.value: The index to check.

data.name: Array_ContainsIndex_ReturnValue
data.value: "True" or "False" depending on if the index was present in the specified.

data.name: Array_ContainsValue
data.value: Gets whether or not the array contains the specified value. This is very useful when deciding if the array's value was stored in some index.

data.name: Array_ContainsValue_array
data.value: The array to check.

data.name: Array_ContainsValue_value
data.value: The value to check.

data.name: Array_ContainsValue_ReturnValue
data.value: "True" or "False" depending on if the value was present in the specified.

data.name: Array_GetAllIndices
data.value: Gets all the indices for the array, as another array.

data.name: Array_GetAllIndices_array
data.value: The array whose indices are requested.

data.name: Array_GetAllIndices_ReturnValue
data.value: An array filled with all the indices of the specified array. The index of the returned array starts from 1.

data.name: Array_GetItemCount
data.value: Gets the number of items stored in the array.

data.name: Array_GetItemCount_array
data.value: The array for which the count is requested.

data.name: Array_GetItemCount_ReturnValue
data.value: The number of items in the specified array.

data.name: Array_IsArray
data.value: Gets whether or not a given variable is an array.

data.name: Array_IsArray_array
data.value: The variable to check.

data.name: Array_IsArray_ReturnValue
data.value: "True" if the specified variable is an array. "False" otherwise.

data.name: Clock
data.value: This class provides access to the system clock

data.name: Clock_Date
data.value: Gets the current system date.

data.name: Clock_Day
data.value: Gets the current day of the month.

data.name: Clock_ElapsedMilliseconds
data.value: Gets the number of milliseconds that have elapsed since 1900.

data.name: Clock_Hour
data.value: Gets the current Hour.

data.name: Clock_Millisecond
data.value: Gets the current Millisecond.

data.name: Clock_Minute
data.value: Gets the current Minute.

data.name: Clock_Month
data.value: Gets the current Month.

data.name: Clock_Second
data.value: Gets the current Second.

data.name: Clock_Time
data.value: Gets the current system time.

data.name: Clock_WeekDay
data.value: Gets the current day of the week.

data.name: Clock_Year
data.value: Gets the current year.

data.name: Controls
data.value: The Controls object allows you to add, move and interact with controls.

data.name: Controls_AddButton
data.value: Adds a button to the graphics window at the specified position.

data.name: Controls_AddButton_caption
data.value: The caption to display in the button.

data.name: Controls_AddButton_left
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the button.

data.name: Controls_AddButton_top
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the button.

data.name: Controls_AddButton_ReturnValue
data.value: The button that was just added to the Graphics Window.

data.name: Controls_AddMultiLineTextBox
data.value: Adds a multi-line text input box to the graphics window at the specified position.

data.name: Controls_AddMultiLineTextBox_left
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the text box.

data.name: Controls_AddMultiLineTextBox_top
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the text box.

data.name: Controls_AddMultiLineTextBox_ReturnValue
data.value: The text box that was just added to the Graphics Window.

data.name: Controls_AddTextBox
data.value: Adds a text input box to the graphics window at the specified position.

data.name: Controls_AddTextBox_left
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the text box.

data.name: Controls_AddTextBox_top
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the text box.

data.name: Controls_AddTextBox_ReturnValue
data.value: The text box that was just added to the Graphics Window.

data.name: Controls_GetButtonCaption
data.value: Gets the current caption of the specified button.

data.name: Controls_GetButtonCaption_buttonName
data.value: The Button whose caption is requested.

data.name: Controls_GetButtonCaption_ReturnValue
data.value: The current caption of the button.

data.name: Controls_GetTextBoxText
data.value: Gets the current text of the specified TextBox.

data.name: Controls_GetTextBoxText_textBoxName
data.value: The TextBox whose text is requested.

data.name: Controls_GetTextBoxText_ReturnValue
data.value: The text in the TextBox

data.name: Controls_HideControl
data.value: Hides an already added control.

data.name: Controls_HideControl_controlName
data.value: The name of the control.

data.name: Controls_Move
data.value: Moves the control with the specified name to a new position.

data.name: Controls_Move_control
data.value: The name of the control to move.

data.name: Controls_Move_x
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the new position.

data.name: Controls_Move_y
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the new position.

data.name: Controls_Remove
data.value: Removes a control from the Graphics Window.

data.name: Controls_Remove_controlName
data.value: The name of the control that needs to be removed.

data.name: Controls_SetButtonCaption
data.value: Sets the caption of the specified button.

data.name: Controls_SetButtonCaption_buttonName
data.value: The Button whose caption needs to be set.

data.name: Controls_SetButtonCaption_caption
data.value: The new caption for the button.

data.name: Controls_SetSize
data.value: Sets the size of the control.

data.name: Controls_SetSize_control
data.value: The name of the control to be resized.

data.name: Controls_SetSize_width
data.value: The width of the control.

data.name: Controls_SetSize_height
data.value: The height of the control.

data.name: Controls_SetTextBoxText
data.value: Sets the text of the specified TextBox.

data.name: Controls_SetTextBoxText_textBoxName
data.value: The TextBox whose text needs to be set.

data.name: Controls_SetTextBoxText_text
data.value: The new text for the TextBox.

data.name: Controls_ShowControl
data.value: Shows a previously hidden control.

data.name: Controls_ShowControl_controlName
data.value: The name of the control.

data.name: Controls_LastClickedButton
data.value: Gets the last Button that was clicked on the Graphics Window.

data.name: Controls_LastTypedTextBox
data.value: Gets the last TextBox, text was typed into.

data.name: Controls_ButtonClicked
data.value: Raises an event when any button control is clicked.

data.name: Controls_TextTyped
data.value: Raises an event when text is typed into any TextBox control.

data.name: Desktop
data.value: This class provides methods to interact with the desktop.

data.name: Desktop_SetWallPaper
data.value: Sets the specified picture as the desktop's wallpaper. This file could be a local file or a network file or even an Internet URL.

data.name: Desktop_SetWallPaper_fileOrUrl
data.value: The filename or URL of the picture.

data.name: Desktop_Height
data.value: Gets the screen height of the primary desktop.

data.name: Desktop_Width
data.value: Gets the screen width of the primary desktop.

data.name: Dictionary
data.value: This class provides access to an online Dictionary service.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinition
data.value: Gets the definition of a word in English. The same as GetDefinitionEnglishToEnglish.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinition_word
data.value: The word to define.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinition_ReturnValue
data.value: The definition(s) of the specified word.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionEnglishToEnglish
data.value: Gets the definition of a word, English to English.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionEnglishToEnglish_word
data.value: The word to define.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionEnglishToEnglish_ReturnValue
data.value: The definition(s) of the specified word.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionEnglishToFrench
data.value: Gets the definition of a word, English to French.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionEnglishToFrench_word
data.value: The word to define.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionEnglishToFrench_ReturnValue
data.value: The definition(s) of the specified word.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionEnglishToGerman
data.value: Gets the definition of a word, English to German.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionEnglishToGerman_word
data.value: The word to define.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionEnglishToGerman_ReturnValue
data.value: The definition(s) of the specified word.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionEnglishToItalian
data.value: Gets the definition of a word, English to Italian.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionEnglishToItalian_word
data.value: The word to define.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionEnglishToItalian_ReturnValue
data.value: The definition(s) of the specified word.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionEnglishToJapanese
data.value: Gets the definition of a word, English to Japanese.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionEnglishToJapanese_word
data.value: The word to define.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionEnglishToJapanese_ReturnValue
data.value: The definition(s) of the specified word.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionEnglishToKorean
data.value: Gets the definition of a word, English to Korean.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionEnglishToKorean_word
data.value: The word to define.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionEnglishToKorean_ReturnValue
data.value: The definition(s) of the specified word.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionEnglishToSimplifiedChinese
data.value: Gets the definition of a word, English to Simplified Chinese.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionEnglishToSimplifiedChinese_word
data.value: The word to define.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionEnglishToSimplifiedChinese_ReturnValue
data.value: The definition(s) of the specified word.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionEnglishToSpanish
data.value: Gets the definition of a word, English to Spanish.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionEnglishToSpanish_word
data.value: The word to define.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionEnglishToSpanish_ReturnValue
data.value: The definition(s) of the specified word.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionEnglishToTraditionalChinese
data.value: Gets the definition of a word, English to Traditional Chinese.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionEnglishToTraditionalChinese_word
data.value: The word to define.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionEnglishToTraditionalChinese_ReturnValue
data.value: The definition(s) of the specified word.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionFrenchToEnglish
data.value: Gets the definition of a word, French to English.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionFrenchToEnglish_word
data.value: The word to define.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionFrenchToEnglish_ReturnValue
data.value: The definition(s) of the specified word.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionGermanToEnglish
data.value: Gets the definition of a word, German to English.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionGermanToEnglish_word
data.value: The word to define.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionGermanToEnglish_ReturnValue
data.value: The definition(s) of the specified word.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionItalianToEnglish
data.value: Gets the definition of a word, Itlian to English.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionItalianToEnglish_word
data.value: The word to define.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionItalianToEnglish_ReturnValue
data.value: The definition(s) of the specified word.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionJapaneseToEnglish
data.value: Gets the definition of a word, Japanese to English.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionJapaneseToEnglish_word
data.value: The word to define.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionJapaneseToEnglish_ReturnValue
data.value: The definition(s) of the specified word.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionKoreanToEnglish
data.value: Gets the definition of a word, Korean to English.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionKoreanToEnglish_word
data.value: The word to define.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionKoreanToEnglish_ReturnValue
data.value: The definition(s) of the specified word.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionSimplifiedChineseToEnglish
data.value: Gets the definition of a word, Simplified Chinese to English.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionSimplifiedChineseToEnglish_word
data.value: The word to define.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionSimplifiedChineseToEnglish_ReturnValue
data.value: The definition(s) of the specified word.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionSpanishToEnglish
data.value: Gets the definition of a word, Spanish to English.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionSpanishToEnglish_word
data.value: The word to define.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionSpanishToEnglish_ReturnValue
data.value: The definition(s) of the specified word.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionTraditionalChineseToEnglish
data.value: Gets the definition of a word, Traditional Chinese to English.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionTraditionalChineseToEnglish_word
data.value: The word to define.

data.name: Dictionary_GetDefinitionTraditionalChineseToEnglish_ReturnValue
data.value: The definition(s) of the specified word.

data.name: File
data.value: The File object provides methods to access, read and write information from and to a file on disk. Using this object, it is possible to save and open settings across multiple sessions of your program.

data.name: File_AppendContents
data.value: Opens the specified file and appends the contents to the end of the file.

data.name: File_AppendContents_filePath
data.value: The full path of the file to read from. An example of a full path will be c:\temp\settings.data.

data.name: File_AppendContents_contents
data.value: The contents to append to the end of the file.

data.name: File_AppendContents_ReturnValue
data.value: If the operation was successful, this will return "SUCCESS". Otherwise, it will return "FAILED".

data.name: File_CopyFile
data.value: Copies the specified source file to the destination file path. If the destination points to a location that doesn't exist, the method will attempt to create it automatically. Existing files will be overwritten. It is always best to check if the destination file exists if you don't want to overwrite existing files.

data.name: File_CopyFile_sourceFilePath
data.value: The full path of the file that needs to be copied. An example of a full path will be c:\temp\settings.data.

data.name: File_CopyFile_destinationFilePath
data.value: The destination location or the file path.

data.name: File_CopyFile_ReturnValue
data.value: If the operation was successful, this will return "SUCCESS". Otherwise, it will return "FAILED".

data.name: File_CreateDirectory
data.value: Creates the specified directory.

data.name: File_CreateDirectory_directoryPath
data.value: The full path of the directory to be created.

data.name: File_CreateDirectory_ReturnValue
data.value: If the operation was successful, this will return "SUCCESS". Otherwise, it will return "FAILED".

data.name: File_DeleteDirectory
data.value: Deletes the specified directory.

data.name: File_DeleteDirectory_directoryPath
data.value: The full path of the directory to be deleted.

data.name: File_DeleteDirectory_ReturnValue
data.value: If the operation was successful, this will return "SUCCESS". Otherwise, it will return "FAILED".

data.name: File_DeleteFile
data.value: Deletes the specified file.

data.name: File_DeleteFile_filePath
data.value: The destination location or the file path. An example of a full path will be c:\temp\settings.data.

data.name: File_DeleteFile_ReturnValue
data.value: If the operation was successful, this will return "SUCCESS". Otherwise, it will return "FAILED".

data.name: File_GetDirectories
data.value: Gets the path of all the directories in the specified directory path.

data.name: File_GetDirectories_directoryPath
data.value: The directory to look for subdirectories.

data.name: File_GetDirectories_ReturnValue
data.value: If the operation was successful, this will return the list of directories as an array. Otherwise, it will return "FAILED".

data.name: File_GetFiles
data.value: Gets the path of all the files in the specified directory path.

data.name: File_GetFiles_directoryPath
data.value: The directory to look for files.

data.name: File_GetFiles_ReturnValue
data.value: If the operation was successful, this will return the files as an array. Otherwise, it will return "FAILED".

data.name: File_GetSettingsFilePath
data.value: Gets the full path of the settings file for this program. The settings file name is based on the program's name and is present in the same location as the program.

data.name: File_GetSettingsFilePath_ReturnValue
data.value: The full path of the settings file specific for this program.

data.name: File_GetTemporaryFilePath
data.value: Creates a new temporary file in a temporary directory and returns the full file path.

data.name: File_GetTemporaryFilePath_ReturnValue
data.value: The full file path of the temporary file.

data.name: File_InsertLine
data.value: Opens the specified file and inserts the contents at the specified line number. This operation will not overwrite any existing content at the specified line.

data.name: File_InsertLine_filePath
data.value: The full path of the file to read from. An example of a full path will be c:\temp\settings.data.

data.name: File_InsertLine_lineNumber
data.value: The line number of the text to insert.

data.name: File_InsertLine_contents
data.value: The contents to insert into the file.

data.name: File_InsertLine_ReturnValue
data.value: If the operation was successful, this will return "SUCCESS". Otherwise, it will return "FAILED".

data.name: File_ReadContents
data.value: Opens a file and reads the entire file's contents. This method will be fast for small files that are less than an MB in size, but will start to slow down and will be noticeable for files greater than 10MB.

data.name: File_ReadContents_filePath
data.value: The full path of the file to read. An example of a full path will be c:\temp\settings.data.

data.name: File_ReadContents_ReturnValue
data.value: The entire contents of the file.

data.name: File_ReadLine
data.value: Opens the specified file and reads the contents at the specified line number.

data.name: File_ReadLine_filePath
data.value: The full path of the file to read from. An example of a full path will be c:\temp\settings.data.

data.name: File_ReadLine_lineNumber
data.value: The line number of the text to be read.

data.name: File_ReadLine_ReturnValue
data.value: The text at the specified line of the specified file.

data.name: File_WriteContents
data.value: Opens a file and writes the specified contents into it, replacing the original contents with the new content.

data.name: File_WriteContents_filePath
data.value: The full path of the file to write to. An example of a full path will be c:\temp\settings.data.

data.name: File_WriteContents_contents
data.value: The contents to write into the specified file.

data.name: File_WriteContents_ReturnValue
data.value: If the operation was successful, this will return "SUCCESS". Otherwise, it will return "FAILED".

data.name: File_WriteLine
data.value: Opens the specified file and write the contents at the specified line number. This operation will overwrite any existing content at the specified line.

data.name: File_WriteLine_filePath
data.value: The full path of the file to read from. An example of a full path will be c:\temp\settings.data.

data.name: File_WriteLine_lineNumber
data.value: The line number of the text to write.

data.name: File_WriteLine_contents
data.value: The contents to write at the specified line of the specified file.

data.name: File_WriteLine_ReturnValue
data.value: If the operation was successful, this will return "SUCCESS". Otherwise, it will return "FAILED".

data.name: File_LastError
data.value: Gets or sets the last encountered file operation based error message. This property is useful for finding out when some method fails to execute.

data.name: Flickr
data.value: This class provides access to Flickr photo services.

data.name: Flickr_GetPictureOfMoment
data.value: Gets the URL for the picture of the moment.

data.name: Flickr_GetPictureOfMoment_ReturnValue
data.value: A file URL for Flickr's picture of the moment

data.name: Flickr_GetRandomPicture
data.value: Gets the URL for a random picture tagged with the specified tag.

data.name: Flickr_GetRandomPicture_tag
data.value: The tag for the requested picture.

data.name: Flickr_GetRandomPicture_ReturnValue
data.value: A file URL for Flickr's random picture

data.name: GraphicsWindow
data.value: The GraphicsWindow provides graphics related input and output functionality. For example, using this class, it is possible to draw and fill circles and rectangles.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_Clear
data.value: Clears the window.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawBoundText
data.value: Draws a line of text on the screen at the specified location.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawBoundText_x
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the text start point.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawBoundText_y
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the text start point.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawBoundText_width
data.value: The maximum available width. This parameter helps define when the text should wrap.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawBoundText_text
data.value: The text to draw.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawEllipse
data.value: Draws an ellipse on the screen using the selected Pen.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawEllipse_x
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the ellipse.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawEllipse_y
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the ellipse.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawEllipse_width
data.value: The width of the ellipse.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawEllipse_height
data.value: The height of the ellipse.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawImage
data.value: Draws the specified image from memory on to the screen.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawImage_imageName
data.value: The name of the image to draw.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawImage_x
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the point to draw the image at.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawImage_y
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the point to draw the image at.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawLine
data.value: Draws a line from one point to another.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawLine_x1
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the first point.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawLine_y1
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the first point.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawLine_x2
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the second point.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawLine_y2
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the second point.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawRectangle
data.value: Draws a rectangle on the screen using the selected Pen.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawRectangle_x
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the rectangle.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawRectangle_y
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the rectangle.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawRectangle_width
data.value: The width of the rectangle.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawRectangle_height
data.value: The height of the rectangle.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawResizedImage
data.value: Draws the specified image from memory on to the screen, in the specified size.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawResizedImage_imageName
data.value: The name of the image to draw

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawResizedImage_x
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the point to draw the image at.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawResizedImage_y
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the point to draw the image at.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawResizedImage_width
data.value: The width to draw the image.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawResizedImage_height
data.value: The height to draw the image.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawText
data.value: Draws a line of text on the screen at the specified location.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawText_x
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the text start point.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawText_y
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the text start point.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawText_text
data.value: The text to draw

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawTriangle
data.value: Draws a triangle on the screen using the selected pen.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawTriangle_x1
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the first point.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawTriangle_y1
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the first point.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawTriangle_x2
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the second point.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawTriangle_y2
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the second point.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawTriangle_x3
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the third point.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_DrawTriangle_y3
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the third point.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_FillEllipse
data.value: Fills an ellipse on the screen using the selected Brush.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_FillEllipse_x
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the ellipse.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_FillEllipse_y
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the ellipse.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_FillEllipse_width
data.value: The width of the ellipse.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_FillEllipse_height
data.value: The height of the ellipse.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_FillRectangle
data.value: Fills a rectangle on the screen using the selected Brush.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_FillRectangle_x
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the rectangle.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_FillRectangle_y
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the rectangle.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_FillRectangle_width
data.value: The width of the rectangle.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_FillRectangle_height
data.value: The height of the rectangle.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_FillTriangle
data.value: Draws and fills a triangle on the screen using the selected brush.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_FillTriangle_x1
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the first point.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_FillTriangle_y1
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the first point.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_FillTriangle_x2
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the second point.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_FillTriangle_y2
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the second point.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_FillTriangle_x3
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the third point.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_FillTriangle_y3
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the third point.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_GetColorFromRGB
data.value: Constructs a color given the Red, Green and Blue values.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_GetColorFromRGB_red
data.value: The red component of the Color (0-255).

data.name: GraphicsWindow_GetColorFromRGB_green
data.value: The green component of the color (0-255).

data.name: GraphicsWindow_GetColorFromRGB_blue
data.value: The blue component of the color (0-255).

data.name: GraphicsWindow_GetColorFromRGB_ReturnValue
data.value: Returns a color that can be used to set the brush or pen color.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_GetPixel
data.value: Gets the color of the pixel at the specified x and y co-ordinates.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_GetPixel_x
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the pixel.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_GetPixel_y
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the pixel.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_GetPixel_ReturnValue
data.value: The color of the pixel.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_GetRandomColor
data.value: Gets a valid random color.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_GetRandomColor_ReturnValue
data.value: A valid random color.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_Hide
data.value: Hides the Graphics window.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_SetPixel
data.value: Draws the pixel specified by the x and y co-ordinates using the specified color.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_SetPixel_x
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the pixel.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_SetPixel_y
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the pixel.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_SetPixel_color
data.value: The color of the pixel to set.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_Show
data.value: Shows the Graphics window to enable interactions with it.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_ShowMessage
data.value: Displays a message box to the user.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_ShowMessage_text
data.value: The text to be displayed on the message box.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_ShowMessage_title
data.value: The title for the message box.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_BackgroundColor
data.value: Gets or sets the Background color of the Graphics Window.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_BrushColor
data.value: Gets or sets the brush color to be used to fill shapes drawn on the Graphics Window.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_CanResize
data.value: Specifies whether or not the Graphics Window can be resized by the user.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_FontBold
data.value: Gets or sets whether or not the font to be used when drawing text on the Graphics Window, is bold.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_FontItalic
data.value: Gets or sets whether or not the font to be used when drawing text on the Graphics Window, is italic.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_FontName
data.value: Gets or sets the Font Name to be used when drawing text on the Graphics Window.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_FontSize
data.value: Gets or sets the Font Size to be used when drawing text on the Graphics Window.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_Height
data.value: Gets or sets the Height of the graphics window.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_LastKey
data.value: Gets the last key that was pressed or released.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_LastText
data.value: Gets the last text that was entered on the Graphics Window.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_Left
data.value: Gets or sets the Left Position of the graphics window.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_MouseX
data.value: Gets the x-position of the mouse relative to the Graphics Window.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_MouseY
data.value: Gets the y-position of the mouse relative to the Graphics Window.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_PenColor
data.value: Gets or sets the color of the pen used to draw shapes on the Graphics Window.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_PenWidth
data.value: Gets or sets the width of the pen used to draw shapes on the Graphics Window.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_Title
data.value: Gets or sets the title for the graphics window.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_Top
data.value: Gets or sets the Top Position of the graphics window.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_Width
data.value: Gets or sets the Width of the graphics window.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_KeyDown
data.value: Raises an event when a key is pressed down on the keyboard.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_KeyUp
data.value: Raises an event when a key is released on the keyboard.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_MouseDown
data.value: Raises an event when the mouse button is clicked down.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_MouseMove
data.value: Raises an event when the mouse is moved around.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_MouseUp
data.value: Raises an event when the mouse button is released.

data.name: GraphicsWindow_TextInput
data.value: Raises an event when text is entered on the GraphicsWindow.

data.name: ImageList
data.value: This class helps to load and store images in memory.

data.name: ImageList_GetHeightOfImage
data.value: Gets the height of the stored image.

data.name: ImageList_GetHeightOfImage_imageName
data.value: The name of the image in memory.

data.name: ImageList_GetHeightOfImage_ReturnValue
data.value: The height of the specified image.

data.name: ImageList_GetWidthOfImage
data.value: Gets the width of the stored image.

data.name: ImageList_GetWidthOfImage_imageName
data.value: The name of the image in memory.

data.name: ImageList_GetWidthOfImage_ReturnValue
data.value: The width of the specified image.

data.name: ImageList_LoadImage
data.value: Loads an image from a file or the Internet into memory.

data.name: ImageList_LoadImage_fileNameOrUrl
data.value: The file name to load the image from. This could be a local file or a URL to the Internet location.

data.name: ImageList_LoadImage_ReturnValue
data.value: Returns the name of the image that was loaded.

data.name: Math
data.value: The Math class provides lots of useful mathematics related methods

data.name: Math_Abs
data.value: Gets the absolute value of the given number. For example, -32.233 will return 32.233.

data.name: Math_Abs_number
data.value: The number to get the absolute value for.

data.name: Math_Abs_ReturnValue
data.value: The absolute value of the given number.

data.name: Math_ArcCos
data.value: Gets the angle in radians, given the cosine value.

data.name: Math_ArcCos_cosValue
data.value: The cosine value whose angle is needed.

data.name: Math_ArcCos_ReturnValue
data.value: The angle (in radians) for the given cosine Value.

data.name: Math_ArcSin
data.value: Gets the angle in radians, given the sin value.

data.name: Math_ArcSin_sinValue
data.value: The sine value whose angle is needed.

data.name: Math_ArcSin_ReturnValue
data.value: The angle (in radians) for the given sine Value.

data.name: Math_ArcTan
data.value: Gets the angle in radians, given the tangent value.

data.name: Math_ArcTan_tanValue
data.value: The tangent value whose angle is needed.

data.name: Math_ArcTan_ReturnValue
data.value: The angle (in radians) for the given tangent Value.

data.name: Math_Ceiling
data.value: Returns the smallest integer that is greater than or equal to the argument. It rounds up the integer value. For example, 32.233 will return 33. Also, 44 will return 44.

data.name: Math_Ceiling_number
data.value: The number whose ceiling is required.

data.name: Math_Ceiling_ReturnValue
data.value: The ceiling value of the given number.

data.name: Math_Cos
data.value: Gets the cosine of the given angle in radians.

data.name: Math_Cos_angle
data.value: The angle whose cosine is needed (in radians).

data.name: Math_Cos_ReturnValue
data.value: The cosine of the given angle.

data.name: Math_Floor
data.value: Returns the largest integer that is less than or equal to the argument. It rounds down the integer value. For example, 32.233 will return 32. Also, 44 will return 44.

data.name: Math_Floor_number
data.value: The number whose floor value is required.

data.name: Math_Floor_ReturnValue
data.value: The floor value of the given number.

data.name: Math_GetDegrees
data.value: Converts a given angle in radians to degrees.

data.name: Math_GetDegrees_angle
data.value: The angle in radians.

data.name: Math_GetDegrees_ReturnValue
data.value: The converted angle in degrees.

data.name: Math_GetRadians
data.value: Converts a given angle in degrees to radians.

data.name: Math_GetRadians_angle
data.value: The angle in degrees.

data.name: Math_GetRadians_ReturnValue
data.value: The converted angle in radians.

data.name: Math_GetRandomNumber
data.value: Gets a random number between 1 and the specified maxNumber (inclusive).

data.name: Math_GetRandomNumber_maxNumber
data.value: The maximum number for the requested random value.

data.name: Math_GetRandomNumber_ReturnValue
data.value: A Random number that is less than or equal to the specified max.

data.name: Math_Log
data.value: Gets the logarithm (base 10) value of the given number.

data.name: Math_Log_number
data.value: The number whose logarithm value is required

data.name: Math_Log_ReturnValue
data.value: The log value of the given number

data.name: Math_Max
data.value: Compares two numbers and returns the greater of the two.

data.name: Math_Max_number1
data.value: The first of the two numbers to compare.

data.name: Math_Max_number2
data.value: The second of the two numbers to compare.

data.name: Math_Max_ReturnValue
data.value: The greater value of the two numbers.

data.name: Math_Min
data.value: Compares two numbers and returns the smaller of the two.

data.name: Math_Min_number1
data.value: The first of the two numbers to compare.

data.name: Math_Min_number2
data.value: The second of the two numbers to compare.

data.name: Math_Min_ReturnValue
data.value: The smaller value of the two numbers.

data.name: Math_NaturalLog
data.value: Gets the natural logarithm value of the given number.

data.name: Math_NaturalLog_number
data.value: The number whose natural logarithm value is required.

data.name: Math_NaturalLog_ReturnValue
data.value: The natural log value of the given number.

data.name: Math_Power
data.value: Raises the base number to the specified power.

data.name: Math_Power_baseNumber
data.value: The number to be raised to the exponent power.

data.name: Math_Power_exponent
data.value: The power to raise the base number.

data.name: Math_Power_ReturnValue
data.value: The base number raised to the specified exponent.

data.name: Math_Remainder
data.value: Divides the first number by the second and returns the remainder.

data.name: Math_Remainder_dividend
data.value: The number to divide.

data.name: Math_Remainder_divisor
data.value: The number that divides.

data.name: Math_Remainder_ReturnValue
data.value: The remainder after the division.

data.name: Math_Round
data.value: Rounds a given number to the nearest integer. For example 32.233 will be rounded to 32.0 while 32.566 will be rounded to 33.

data.name: Math_Round_number
data.value: The number whose approximation is required.

data.name: Math_Round_ReturnValue
data.value: The rounded value of the given number.

data.name: Math_Sin
data.value: Gets the sine of the given angle in radians.

data.name: Math_Sin_angle
data.value: The angle whose sine is needed (in radians)

data.name: Math_Sin_ReturnValue
data.value: The sine of the given angle

data.name: Math_SquareRoot
data.value: Gets the square root of a given number.

data.name: Math_SquareRoot_number
data.value: The number whose square root value is needed.

data.name: Math_SquareRoot_ReturnValue
data.value: The square root value of the given number.

data.name: Math_Tan
data.value: Gets the tangent of the given angle in radians.

data.name: Math_Tan_angle
data.value: The angle whose tangent is needed (in radians).

data.name: Math_Tan_ReturnValue
data.value: The tangent of the given angle.

data.name: Math_Pi
data.value: Gets the value of Pi

data.name: Mouse
data.value: The mouse class provides accessors to get or set the mouse related properties, like the cursor position, pointer, etc.

data.name: Mouse_HideCursor
data.value: Hides the mouse cursor on the screen.

data.name: Mouse_ShowCursor
data.value: Shows the mouse cursors on the screen.

data.name: Mouse_IsLeftButtonDown
data.value: Gets whether or not the left button is pressed.

data.name: Mouse_IsRightButtonDown
data.value: Gets whether or not the right button is pressed.

data.name: Mouse_MouseX
data.value: Gets or sets the mouse cursor's x co-ordinate.

data.name: Mouse_MouseY
data.value: Gets or sets the mouse cursor's y co-ordinate.

data.name: Network
data.value: This helper class provides network access methods

data.name: Network_DownloadFile
data.value: Downloads a file from the network to a local temporary file.

data.name: Network_DownloadFile_url
data.value: The URL of the file on the network.

data.name: Network_DownloadFile_ReturnValue
data.value: A local file name that the remote file was downloaded as.

data.name: Network_GetWebPageContents
data.value: Gets the contents of a specified web page.

data.name: Network_GetWebPageContents_url
data.value: The URL of the web page

data.name: Network_GetWebPageContents_ReturnValue
data.value: The contents of the specified web page.

data.name: Program
data.value: The Program class provides helpers to control the program execution.

data.name: Program_Delay
data.value: Delays program execution by the specified amount of MilliSeconds.

data.name: Program_Delay_milliSeconds
data.value: The amount of delay.

data.name: Program_End
data.value: Ends the program.

data.name: Program_GetArgument
data.value: Returns the specified argument passed to this program.

data.name: Program_GetArgument_index
data.value: Index of the argument.

data.name: Program_GetArgument_ReturnValue
data.value: The command-line argument at the specified index.

data.name: Program_ArgumentCount
data.value: Gets the number of command-line arguments passed to this program.

data.name: Program_Directory
data.value: Gets the executing program's directory.

data.name: Shapes
data.value: The Shape object allows you to add, move and rotate shapes to the Graphics window.

data.name: Shapes_AddEllipse
data.value: Adds an ellipse shape with the specified width and height.

data.name: Shapes_AddEllipse_width
data.value: The width of the ellipse shape.

data.name: Shapes_AddEllipse_height
data.value: The height of the ellipse shape.

data.name: Shapes_AddEllipse_ReturnValue
data.value: The Ellipse shape that was just added to the Graphics Window.

data.name: Shapes_AddImage
data.value: Adds an image as a shape that can be moved, animated or rotated.

data.name: Shapes_AddImage_imageName
data.value: The name of the image to draw.

data.name: Shapes_AddImage_ReturnValue
data.value: The image that was just added to the Graphics Window.

data.name: Shapes_AddLine
data.value: Adds a line between the specified points.

data.name: Shapes_AddLine_x1
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the first point.

data.name: Shapes_AddLine_y1
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the first point.

data.name: Shapes_AddLine_x2
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the second point.

data.name: Shapes_AddLine_y2
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the second point.

data.name: Shapes_AddLine_ReturnValue
data.value: The line that was just added to the Graphics Window.

data.name: Shapes_AddRectangle
data.value: Adds a rectangle shape with the specified width and height.

data.name: Shapes_AddRectangle_width
data.value: The width of the rectangle shape.

data.name: Shapes_AddRectangle_height
data.value: The height of the rectangle shape.

data.name: Shapes_AddRectangle_ReturnValue
data.value: The Rectangle shape that was just added to the Graphics Window.

data.name: Shapes_AddText
data.value: Adds some text as a shape that can be moved, animated or rotated.

data.name: Shapes_AddText_text
data.value: The text to add.

data.name: Shapes_AddText_ReturnValue
data.value: The text shape that was just added to the Graphics Window.

data.name: Shapes_AddTriangle
data.value: Adds a triangle shape represented by the specified points.

data.name: Shapes_AddTriangle_x1
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the first point.

data.name: Shapes_AddTriangle_y1
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the first point.

data.name: Shapes_AddTriangle_x2
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the second point.

data.name: Shapes_AddTriangle_y2
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the second point.

data.name: Shapes_AddTriangle_x3
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the third point.

data.name: Shapes_AddTriangle_y3
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the third point.

data.name: Shapes_AddTriangle_ReturnValue
data.value: The Triangle shape that was just added to the Graphics Window.

data.name: Shapes_Animate
data.value: Animates a shape with the specified name to a new position.

data.name: Shapes_Animate_shapeName
data.value: The name of the shape to move.

data.name: Shapes_Animate_x
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the new position.

data.name: Shapes_Animate_y
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the new position.

data.name: Shapes_Animate_duration
data.value: The time for the animation, in milliseconds.

data.name: Shapes_GetLeft
data.value: Gets the left co-ordinate of the specified shape.

data.name: Shapes_GetLeft_shapeName
data.value: The name of the shape.

data.name: Shapes_GetLeft_ReturnValue
data.value: The left co-ordinate of the shape.

data.name: Shapes_GetOpacity
data.value: Gets the opacity of a shape.

data.name: Shapes_GetOpacity_shapeName
data.value: The name of the shape.

data.name: Shapes_GetOpacity_ReturnValue
data.value: The opacity of the object as a value between 0 and 100. 0 is completely transparent and 100 is completely opaque.

data.name: Shapes_GetTop
data.value: Gets the top co-ordinate of the specified shape.

data.name: Shapes_GetTop_shapeName
data.value: The name of the shape.

data.name: Shapes_GetTop_ReturnValue
data.value: The top co-ordinate of the shape.

data.name: Shapes_HideShape
data.value: Hides an already added shape.

data.name: Shapes_HideShape_shapeName
data.value: The name of the shape.

data.name: Shapes_Move
data.value: Moves the shape with the specified name to a new position.

data.name: Shapes_Move_shapeName
data.value: The name of the shape to move.

data.name: Shapes_Move_x
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the new position.

data.name: Shapes_Move_y
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the new position.

data.name: Shapes_Remove
data.value: Removes a shape from the Graphics Window.

data.name: Shapes_Remove_shapeName
data.value: The name of the shape that needs to be removed.

data.name: Shapes_Rotate
data.value: Rotates the shape with the specified name to the specified angle.

data.name: Shapes_Rotate_shapeName
data.value: The name of the shape to rotate.

data.name: Shapes_Rotate_angle
data.value: The angle to rotate the shape.

data.name: Shapes_SetOpacity
data.value: Sets how opaque a shape should render.

data.name: Shapes_SetOpacity_shapeName
data.value: The name of the shape.

data.name: Shapes_SetOpacity_level
data.value: The opacity level ranging from 0 to 100. 0 is completely transparent and 100 is completely opaque.

data.name: Shapes_SetText
data.value: Sets the text of a text shape.

data.name: Shapes_SetText_shapeName
data.value: The name of the text shape.

data.name: Shapes_SetText_text
data.value: The new text value to set.

data.name: Shapes_ShowShape
data.value: Shows a previously hidden shape.

data.name: Shapes_ShowShape_shapeName
data.value: The name of the shape.

data.name: Shapes_Zoom
data.value: Scales the shape using the specified zoom levels. Minimum is 0.1 and maximum is 20.

data.name: Shapes_Zoom_shapeName
data.value: The name of the shape to zoom.

data.name: Shapes_Zoom_scaleX
data.value: The x-axis zoom level.

data.name: Shapes_Zoom_scaleY
data.value: The y-axis zoom level.

data.name: Sound
data.value: The Sound object provides operations that allow the playback of sounds. Some sample sounds are provided along with the library.

data.name: Sound_Pause
data.value: Pauses playback of an audio file. If the file was not already playing, this operation will not do anything.

data.name: Sound_Pause_filePath
data.value: The path for the audio file. This could either be a local file (e.g.: c:\music\track1.mp3) or a file on the network (e.g.: http://contoso.com/track01.wma).

data.name: Sound_Play
data.value: Plays an audio file. This could be an mp3 or wav or wma file. Other file formats may or may not play depending on the audio codecs installed on the user's computer. If the file was already paused, this operation will resume from the position where the playback was paused.

data.name: Sound_Play_filePath
data.value: The path for the audio file. This could either be a local file (e.g.: c:\music\track1.mp3) or a file on the network (e.g.: http://contoso.com/track01.wma).

data.name: Sound_PlayAndWait
data.value: Plays an audio file and waits until it is finished playing. This could be an mp3 or wav or wma file. Other file formats may or may not play depending on the audio codecs installed on the user's computer. If the file was already paused, this operation will resume from the position where the playback was paused.

data.name: Sound_PlayAndWait_filePath
data.value: The path for the audio file. This could either be a local file (e.g.: c:\music\track1.mp3) or a file on the network (e.g.: http://contoso.com/track01.wma).

data.name: Sound_PlayBellRing
data.value: Plays the Bell Ring Sound.

data.name: Sound_PlayBellRingAndWait
data.value: Plays the Bell Ring Sound and waits for it to finish.

data.name: Sound_PlayChime
data.value: Plays the Chime Sound.

data.name: Sound_PlayChimeAndWait
data.value: Plays the Chime Sound and waits for it to finish.

data.name: Sound_PlayChimes
data.value: Plays the Chimes Sound.

data.name: Sound_PlayChimesAndWait
data.value: Plays the Chimes Sound and waits for it to finish.

data.name: Sound_PlayClick
data.value: Plays the Click Sound.

data.name: Sound_PlayClickAndWait
data.value: Plays the Click Sound and waits for it to finish.

data.name: Sound_PlayMusic
data.value: Plays musical notes.

data.name: Sound_PlayMusic_notes
data.value: A set of musical notes to play. The format is a subset of the Music Macro Language supported by QBasic.

data.name: Sound_Stop
data.value: Stops playback of an audio file. If the file was not already playing, this operation will not do anything.

data.name: Sound_Stop_filePath
data.value: The path for the audio file. This could either be a local file (e.g.: c:\music\track1.mp3) or a file on the network (e.g.: http://contoso.com/track01.wma).

data.name: Stack
data.value: This object provides a way of storing values just like stacking up a plate. You can push a value to the top of the stack and pop it off. You can only pop the values one by one off the stack and the last pushed value will be the first one to pop out.

data.name: Stack_GetCount
data.value: Gets the count of items in the specified stack.

data.name: Stack_GetCount_stackName
data.value: The name of the stack.

data.name: Stack_GetCount_ReturnValue
data.value: The number of items in the specified stack.

data.name: Stack_PopValue
data.value: Pops the value from the specified stack.

data.name: Stack_PopValue_stackName
data.value: The name of the stack.

data.name: Stack_PopValue_ReturnValue
data.value: The value from the stack.

data.name: Stack_PushValue
data.value: Pushes a value to the specified stack.

data.name: Stack_PushValue_stackName
data.value: The name of the stack.

data.name: Stack_PushValue_value
data.value: The value to push.

data.name: Text
data.value: The Text object provides helpful operations for working with Text.

data.name: Text_Append
data.value: Appends two text inputs and returns the result as another text. This operation is particularly useful when dealing with unknown text in variables which could accidentally be treated as numbers and get added, instead of getting appended.

data.name: Text_Append_text1
data.value: First part of the text to be appended.

data.name: Text_Append_text2
data.value: Second part of the text to be appended.

data.name: Text_Append_ReturnValue
data.value: The appended text containing both the specified parts.

data.name: Text_ConvertToLowerCase
data.value: Converts the given text to lower case.

data.name: Text_ConvertToLowerCase_text
data.value: The text to convert to lower case.

data.name: Text_ConvertToLowerCase_ReturnValue
data.value: The lower case version of the given text.

data.name: Text_ConvertToUpperCase
data.value: Converts the given text to upper case.

data.name: Text_ConvertToUpperCase_text
data.value: The text to convert to upper case.

data.name: Text_ConvertToUpperCase_ReturnValue
data.value: The upper case version of the given text.

data.name: Text_EndsWith
data.value: Gets whether or not a given text ends with the specified subText.

data.name: Text_EndsWith_text
data.value: The larger text to search within.

data.name: Text_EndsWith_subText
data.value: The sub-text to search for.

data.name: Text_EndsWith_ReturnValue
data.value: True if the subtext was found at the end of the given text.

data.name: Text_GetCharacter
data.value: Given the Unicode character code, gets the corresponding character, which can then be used with regular text.

data.name: Text_GetCharacter_characterCode
data.value: The character code (Unicode based) for the required character.

data.name: Text_GetCharacter_ReturnValue
data.value: A Unicode character that corresponds to the code specified.

data.name: Text_GetCharacterCode
data.value: Given a Unicode character, gets the corresponding character code.

data.name: Text_GetCharacterCode_character
data.value: The character whose code is requested.

data.name: Text_GetCharacterCode_ReturnValue
data.value: A Unicode based code that corresponds to the character specified.

data.name: Text_GetIndexOf
data.value: Finds the position where a sub-text appears in the specified text.

data.name: Text_GetIndexOf_text
data.value: The text to search in.

data.name: Text_GetIndexOf_subText
data.value: The text to search for.

data.name: Text_GetIndexOf_ReturnValue
data.value: The position at which the sub-text appears in the specified text. If the text doesn't appear, it returns 0.

data.name: Text_GetLength
data.value: Gets the length of the given text.

data.name: Text_GetLength_text
data.value: The text whose length is needed.

data.name: Text_GetLength_ReturnValue
data.value: The length of the given text.

data.name: Text_GetSubText
data.value: Gets a sub-text from the given text.

data.name: Text_GetSubText_text
data.value: The text to derive the sub-text from.

data.name: Text_GetSubText_start
data.value: Specifies where to start from.

data.name: Text_GetSubText_length
data.value: Specifies the length of the sub text.

data.name: Text_GetSubText_ReturnValue
data.value: The requested sub-text

data.name: Text_GetSubTextToEnd
data.value: Gets a sub-text from the given text from a specified position to the end.

data.name: Text_GetSubTextToEnd_text
data.value: The text to derive the sub-text from.

data.name: Text_GetSubTextToEnd_start
data.value: Specifies where to start from.

data.name: Text_GetSubTextToEnd_ReturnValue
data.value: The requested sub-text.

data.name: Text_IsSubText
data.value: Gets whether or not a given subText is a subset of the larger text.

data.name: Text_IsSubText_text
data.value: The larger text within which the sub-text will be searched.

data.name: Text_IsSubText_subText
data.value: The sub-text to search for.

data.name: Text_IsSubText_ReturnValue
data.value: True if the subtext was found within the given text.

data.name: Text_StartsWith
data.value: Gets whether or not a given text starts with the specified subText.

data.name: Text_StartsWith_text
data.value: The larger text to search within.

data.name: Text_StartsWith_subText
data.value: The sub-text to search for.

data.name: Text_StartsWith_ReturnValue
data.value: True if the subtext was found at the start of the given text.

data.name: TextWindow
data.value: The TextWindow provides text-related input and output functionalities. For example using this class, it is possible to write or read some text or number to and from the text-based text window.

data.name: TextWindow_Clear
data.value: Clears the TextWindow.

data.name: TextWindow_Hide
data.value: Hides the text window. Content is perserved when the window is shown again.

data.name: TextWindow_Pause
data.value: Waits for user input before returning.

data.name: TextWindow_PauseIfVisible
data.value: Waits for user input only when the TextWindow is already open.

data.name: TextWindow_PauseWithoutMessage
data.value: Waits for user input before returning.

data.name: TextWindow_Read
data.value: Reads a line of text from the text window. This function will not return until the user hits ENTER.

data.name: TextWindow_Read_ReturnValue
data.value: The text that was read from the text window

data.name: TextWindow_ReadNumber
data.value: Reads a number from the text window. This function will not return until the user hits ENTER.

data.name: TextWindow_ReadNumber_ReturnValue
data.value: The number that was read from the text window

data.name: TextWindow_Show
data.value: Shows the Text window to enable interactions with it.

data.name: TextWindow_Write
data.value: Writes text or number to the text window. Unlike WriteLine, this will not append a new line character, which means, anything written to the text window after this call will be on the same line.

data.name: TextWindow_Write_data
data.value: The text or number to write to the text window

data.name: TextWindow_WriteLine
data.value: Writes text or number to the text window. A new line character will be appended to the output, so that the next time something is written to the text window, it will go in a new line.

data.name: TextWindow_WriteLine_data
data.value: The text or number to write to the text window.

data.name: TextWindow_BackgroundColor
data.value: Gets or sets the background color of the text to be output in the text window.

data.name: TextWindow_CursorLeft
data.value: Gets or sets the cursor's column position on the text window.

data.name: TextWindow_CursorTop
data.value: Gets or sets the cursor's row position on the text window.

data.name: TextWindow_ForegroundColor
data.value: Gets or sets the foreground color of the text to be output in the text window.

data.name: TextWindow_Left
data.value: Gets or sets the Left position of the Text Window.

data.name: TextWindow_Title
data.value: Gets or sets the Title for the text window.

data.name: TextWindow_Top
data.value: Gets or sets the Top position of the Text Window.

data.name: Timer
data.value: The Timer object provides an easy way for doing something repeatedly with a constant interval between.

data.name: Timer_Pause
data.value: Pauses the timer. Tick events will not be raised.

data.name: Timer_Resume
data.value: Resumes the timer from a paused state. Tick events will now be raised.

data.name: Timer_Interval
data.value: Gets or sets the interval (in milliseconds) specifying how often the timer should raise the Tick event. This value can range from 10 to 100000000

data.name: Timer_Tick
data.value: Raises an event when the timer ticks.

data.name: Turtle
data.value: The Turtle provides Logo-like functionality to draw shapes by manipulating the properties of a pen and drawing primitives.

data.name: Turtle_Hide
data.value: Hides the Turtle and disables interactions with it.

data.name: Turtle_Move
data.value: Moves the turtle to a specified distance. If the pen is down, it will draw a line as it moves.

data.name: Turtle_Move_distance
data.value: The distance to move the turtle.

data.name: Turtle_MoveTo
data.value: Turns and moves the turtle to the specified location. If the pen is down, it will draw a line as it moves.

data.name: Turtle_MoveTo_x
data.value: The x co-ordinate of the destination point.

data.name: Turtle_MoveTo_y
data.value: The y co-ordinate of the destination point.

data.name: Turtle_PenDown
data.value: Sets the pen down to enable the turtle to draw as it moves.

data.name: Turtle_PenUp
data.value: Lifts the pen up to stop drawing as the turtle moves.

data.name: Turtle_Show
data.value: Shows the Turtle to enable interactions with it.

data.name: Turtle_Turn
data.value: Turns the turtle by the specified angle. Angle is in degrees and can be either positive or negative. If the angle is positive, the turtle turns to its right. If it is negative, the turtle turns to its left.

data.name: Turtle_Turn_angle
data.value: The angle to turn the turtle.

data.name: Turtle_TurnLeft
data.value: Turns the turtle 90 degrees to the left.

data.name: Turtle_TurnRight
data.value: Turns the turtle 90 degrees to the right.

data.name: Turtle_Angle
data.value: Gets or sets the current angle of the turtle. While setting, this will turn the turtle instantly to the new angle.

data.name: Turtle_Speed
data.value: Specifies how fast the turtle should move. Valid values are 1 to 10. If Speed is set to 10, the turtle moves and rotates instantly.

data.name: Turtle_X
data.value: Gets or sets the X location of the Turtle. While setting, this will move the turtle instantly to the new location.

data.name: Turtle_Y
data.value: Gets or sets the Y location of the Turtle. While setting, this will move the turtle instantly to the new location.
